meanings.definition: Misavers (noun): A person who saves money poorly.
meanings.sent1: My friend is a misavers and always struggles to save money for emergencies.
meanings.sent2: The misavers had a hard time budgeting and often found themselves in debt.
meanings.sent3: The misavers thought they were saving money by buying everything on sale, but ended up spending more.
meanings.sent4: Being a misavers is like trying to fill a leaky bucket with water.
meanings.sent5: The misavers' wallet was always empty, no matter how much they tried to save.

meanings.definition: Misavers (verb): To save money poorly or inefficiently.
meanings.sent1: I tend to misavers whenever I go shopping and end up overspending.
meanings.sent2: She realized she had been misaversing for years when she checked her savings account.
meanings.sent3: Trying to misavers by cutting corners only led to more financial troubles.
meanings.sent4: Misaversing is like planting seeds in rocky soil and expecting a bountiful harvest.
meanings.sent5: He misaversed his way through life, always struggling to make ends meet.
